abstract: A class that looks up a geographic coordinate using the provided string.
overview:
## Discussion

Use this class to look up the coordinate for an address string you provide, for example if you want to display the location in a map. This example shows how to use a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Task] modifier on a SwiftUI view to geocode an array of street addresses to the corresponding coordinates that MapKit returns in an array of [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKMapItem] objects.

items.description: Initializes a new geocoder request object with the provided address string.
items.name: init(addressString:)

items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the current geocoding request is in a loading state.
items.name: isLoading

items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the current geocoding request is in a cancelled state.
items.name: isCancelled

items.description: A function you call to cancel a geocoding request that’s in progress.
items.name: cancel()

items.description: The string used to initialize the geocoder.
items.name: addressString

items.description: Returns the map items relevant to the geocoded location.
items.name: getMapItems(completionHandler:)

items.description: A value that indicates the default locale the geocoder should use when processing requests.
items.name: preferredLocale

items.description: The geographic region for the framework to use as the bounds for the request; defaults to a region that covers the whole world.
items.name: region

items.description: A class that looks up address strings for the provided geographic coordinates.
items.name: MKReverseGeocodingRequest

title: MKGeocodingRequest
